definition: to entrust (to sb)/to place (one's hope, energy etc) in/a thing in which you invest (your hope, energy etc)
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: A bailment of telesthesia you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你是我心上一点点寄托。

sentences.english: Have you found your metaphor for where your mother is?
sentences.chinese: 你找到寄托自己母亲的象征物了吗？

sentences.english: It is people emotion reposing merely.
sentences.chinese: 它仅仅是人们情感的寄托物。

sentences.english: The image embodied in these names is usually the spirit which the literati pursues in their whole life.
sentences.chinese: 室名别号所蕴含的意象，往往是文人毕生精神的寄托。

sentences.english: At present realizing temper justice with mercy policy is more attached to judicial process.
sentences.chinese: 实现宽严相济政策，目前更多地寄托于司法过程。

sentences.english: Well, I think the world of Wuxia is more than a utopia. It is a cultural harbor where one can anchor.
sentences.chinese: “武侠”，不只是想象的世界，更是文化心灵的寄托。

sentences.english: Residents and authorities had been pinning their hopes on sandbagging.
sentences.chinese: 市民和当局都将他们的希望寄托在沙袋上。

sentences.english: British hopes of a medal rested on Ovett.
sentences.chinese: 英国把获得奖牌的希望寄托在奥维特的身上。

sentences.english: On the day, people offered sacrifices and expressed their thoughts and feelings under the full, bright moon.
sentences.chinese: 中秋当日，人们对着天上皓月观赏祭拜，寄托情怀。

sentences.english: The round moon, placing people how happy living the dream.
sentences.chinese: 圆圆的月亮，寄托着人们多少美满生活的梦想。

sentences.english: Revealed in the book by the author of unreasoning passion and the images of their Qingchi.
sentences.chinese: 揭示了作者在书中借助人物形象寄托的痴情和情痴。

sentences.english: The second is the unsuccessful scholars' spiritual sustenance and restructuring of the value.
sentences.chinese: 不得志文人的精神寄托和价值重构之所。
宿命论是纳齐恩斯基的唯一寄托。

sentences.english: They fixed all their hopes on their king.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他们所有的希望寄托在国王的身上。

sentences.english: Because, that is one kind of hope, is also one kind worries and reposes.
sentences.chinese: 因为，那是一种希望，也是一种牵挂和寄托。

sentences.english: You are the salt of the world. Our wish is arranged on you.
sentences.chinese: 你们都是优秀分子，我们的希望寄托在你们身上。
